result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Brian Scifo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNa surcharge by 10/23/2018 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

work Search Log not filed/date stamped; letter of apology filed/date stamped 3/16/16; proof of community served filed/date stamped 5/16/2016, Justice point report filed/date stamped 5/16/16.  Now scanned.

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), an unclassified Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court ordered Defendant to serve TWO (2) DAYS with credit for TWO (2) DAYS.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 10-23-2018 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Per Defense.  Matter is RESCHEDULED to 10-23-2017 at 01:30 pm for Review.  sdg
Court is DOWN 08-29-2017.  Matter is RESCHEDULED to 09-18-2017 at 01:30 pm for Review.  sdg

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has remaining SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($7,550.00) in Restitution.  Defense requested an adjournment for Review.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for final Review.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

**COURT VACATED THE STAYED WARRANT FROM THE PREVIOUS DATE**

Defense advised that there is a payment in place with Defendant's employer.  Defense requested a NINETY (90) DAY adjournment for the purposes of paying Restitution.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J. Dvorak in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant is at work.  Defense advised that Defendant has forgot about the Hearing.  Defense advised that Defendant is making Restitution payments in the amount of ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($100.00) PER MONTH.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has completed Community Service and the Letter of Apology.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  ON MOTION OF THE STATE,  COURT DISCHARGED DEFENDANT FROM ANY AND ALL JUSTICEPOINT SUPERVISION.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant has located employment and will be able to begin paying towards Restitution.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant has began Community Service.  No discussions have occurred regarding the 'good faith effort' towards restitution.  If Defendant is unemployed,  Defendant to provid documentation regarding job search efforts.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BRIAN B.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Review hearing in Branch 33.

CASE PASSED AT 09:11 am.

CASE RECALLED AT 09:22 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

Defendant Anthony Brian Scifo in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
